Flittle (Japanese: ヒラヒナ Hirahina) is a Psychic-type Pokémon introduced in Generation IX.

It evolves into Espathra starting at level 35.

Biology

Flittle is a small Pokémon resembling a bird chick, with a yellow body, large blue eyes with a lavender triangular mark between them, and a small lavender mouth. It has white frills on its head and both yellow and pink frills extending from its belly, which it uses to emit psychic energy. Its pointed feet are extremely small and appear to serve no use in movement, dangling from its body as it levitates above the ground.

Flittle spends most of its time roaming wastelands and mountainous regions. Flittle is also known to be quite vengeful. Should anyone steal Flittle's berries, it will chase after them for revenge.

Evolution

Flittle evolves into Espathra.

(For specifics on this Pokémon's Evolution in the games, refer to Game data→Evolution data.)

Pokédex entries

This Pokémon was unavailable prior to Generation IX.
Generation IX Paldea
#263 		Kitakami
#— 		Blueberry
#—
Scarlet Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon’s belly.
Violet It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

In animation

Main series

Major appearances

Minor appearances

A Flittle appeared in a flashback in Ice Battle! Cold-Eyed Grusha, under the ownership of a Trainer.

A Student's Flittle appeared in HZ101.

POKÉTOON

A Trainer's Flittle appeared in PT16.

In the manga

Pokémon Adventures

Flittle debuted in Discover! The Quaking Earth Titan!!.

Two Flittle appeared in Battle! Team Star, the Delinquents!!. At West Province (Area One), Violet battled one as part of his training.

In the TCG

Main article: Flittle (TCG)

Trivia

  • Flittle was designed by Atsuko Nishida.[1]

Origin

Flittle's appearance may be based on the chicks of various bird species. The frills on its body resemble a frilled dress or gown. Its overall body shape may also be inspired by an ostrich egg or the dumbo octopus. It also remotely resembles a U.F.O., specifically a flying saucer.

Name origin

Flittle may be a combination of flitter (a fluttering movement) and little.

Hirahina may be a combination of ひらひら hirahira (onomatopoetic word for fluttering) and 雛 hina (chick).

In other languages

Language Title Meaning
Japanese ヒラヒナ Hirahina From ひらひら hirahira and 雛 hina
French Flotillon From flotter and oisillon
Spanish Flittle Same as English name
German Flattutu From flattern and Tutu
Italian Flittle Same as English name
Korean 하느라기 Haneuragi From 하늘하늘 haneul-haneul and 아기 agi
Mandarin Chinese 飄飄雛 / 飘飘雏 Piāopiāochú From 飄飄 / 飘飘 piāopiāo and 雛 chú
Cantonese Chinese 飄飄雛 Pīupīuchòh From 飄飄 pīupīu and 雛 chòh
